page.title: 04STATISTICAL SURVEY-MENSTRIE
page.content: Our recent survey of around 1000 homes in Menstrie revealed several interesting facts. Many families have four in the family. In fact 75% of the people we interviewed had a family of four. Some of the people we interviewed had come from the north east of Scotland and Glasgow. Many of the people who came from the north east came because of Glenochil Detention Centre nearby, the men being prison officers. D.C.L. brought families from Glasgow to work in the local yeast factory. Much of the population work nearby but some work as far away as Papua, New Guinea. In a lot of cases both the husband and wife work. Our survey underlined the fact that Menstrie is a commuter area which is amply served by buses and trains nearby.
